in_text.heading: Diuretics
in_text.statement:
Diuretics are medications that increase excretion of sodium and water, aiming to achieve
a negative sodium balance and reduce fluid accumulation in the abdominal cavity.8

in_text.heading: Diuretics
in_text.statement:
Oral administration, especially for
ascites from liver cirrhosis
(requires careful assessment of kidney function,
risk of hypovolemia, and ototoxicity)9

in_text.heading: Indwelling Peritoneal Catheter
in_text.statement:
Minimally invasive placement: A small tube is inserted through a
tiny abdomen incision during a simple outpatient procedure. 16,17

in_text.heading: Indwelling Peritoneal Catheter
in_text.statement:
Simple home drainage: When fluid builds up, connect the tube to a
vacuum bottle. Each session takes 5-15 minutes. 17

in_text.heading: Indwelling Peritoneal Catheter
in_text.statement:
Continuous symptom control: Drain fluid at home, reducing
hospital visits and improving comfort.14
